title: Saratoga National Historical Park: Getting Around
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Getting Around              Getting Around       Driving The Battlefield has a self-guiding 10-mile paved Tour Road. Entrance fees apply; see Fees & Passes.      Bicycling  Bicycling is a fantastic way to explore the Battlefield portion of Saratoga National Historical Park in the spring, summer, and autumn! There are currently no bike rentals at the park, so visitors need to bring their own bicycles. Entrance fees apply: see Fees & Passes. Helmets are required for all cyclists.      Hiking Hiking is also a great way of exploring the Battlefield throughout the year. In winter, weather permitting, the hiking trails become a cross-country skiing and snowshoeing destination. Entrance fees apply; see Fees & Passes.      Horseback Riding While there are no horse rentals at the park, visitors with their own horses may bring them to Saratoga Battlefield and make use of our 5+mile (round trip) horse trail. Entrance fees apply; see Fees & Passes.      Public Transportation There are no public transportation forms that regularly service Saratoga National Historical Park.  The park is not on any bus lines or regular taxi routes. Amtrak has a station in Saratoga Springs, NY, approximately 15 miles west of the park. Albany International Airport is located in Albany, NY, approximately 30 miles south of the park.
